channel.title: Security Now (Audio)
channel.itunes:author: TWiT
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/
channel.itunes:subtitle: Expert Steve Gibson discusses the current threats, risks, and tech breaches everyone is facing in security today.
channel.itunes:summary:
Cybersecurity guru Steve Gibson joins Leo Laporte every Tuesday. Steve and Leo break down the latest cybercrime and hacking stories, offering a deep understanding of what's happening and how to protect yourself and your business. Security Now is a must listen for security professionals every week.
Records live every Tuesday at 4:30pm Eastern / 1:30pm Pacific / 20:30 UTC.
channel.description:
Cybersecurity guru Steve Gibson joins Leo Laporte every Tuesday. Steve and Leo break down the latest cybercrime and hacking stories, offering a deep understanding of what's happening and how to protect yourself and your business. Security Now is a must listen for security professionals every week.
Records live every Tuesday at 4:30pm Eastern / 1:30pm Pacific / 20:30 UTC.
channel.itunes:keywords: TWiT, Technology, Steve Gibson, Leo Laporte, security, spyware, malware, hacking, cyber crime, encryption

item.title: SN 995: uBlock Origin & Manifest V3 - DDoS Record, N. Korean Workers, Vitamin D
item.itunes:title: uBlock Origin & Manifest V3 - DDoS Record, N. Korean Workers, Vitamin D
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: DDoS Record, N. Korean Workers, Vitamin D
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, Facebook, Meta, paypal, DDoS, asus, routers, north korea, Vitamin D, cups vilnerability, ublok, UBlock Origin, manifest v2, manifest v3
item.description:
• Facebook's parent Meta not hashing passwords
  • A New, forthcoming PayPal default opts their users into merchant data sharing
  • DDoS breaks another record
  • Speaking of these ASUS routers
  • Do you know who you're hiring?
  • Vitamin D
  • The CUPS vulnerablility
  • Routers for normal people
  • uBlock Origin & Manifest V3

Show Notes: https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-995-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • bitwarden.com/twit
  • Melissa.com/twit

  • flashpoint.io

item.title: SN 994: Recall's Re-Rollout - Domain Security, Tor + Tails, VLC Update

item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Domain Security, Tor + Tails, VLC Update
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, Linux, roskomnadzor, vlc, telegram, tor, tails, enshittification, bobiverse, Windows, experian, nuevomailer, SpinRite, peter f hamilton, recall, Microsoft, copilot
item.description:
• The Linux remote code execution flaw
  • The CRUCIAL importance of Domain Control Security
  • Roskomnadzor strikes a discordant note
  • VLC gets a security update
  • Tor and Tails Merge
  • Telegram changes its long-standing "zero cooperation" policy
  • Enshittification
  • Bobiverse book 5
  • Windows 10 notifications
  • Experian woes
  • Nuevomailer
  • SpinRite
  • Peter F. Hamilton
  • Recall's Re-Rollout

item.title: SN 993: Kaspersky exits the U.S. - Exploding Pagers, Passkeys in Chrome

item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Exploding Pagers, Passkeys in Chrome
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, pagers, walkie talkies, Israel, hezbollah, ford, data breach, passkeys, chrome, Google, Linux, credit, drobo, Synology, kaspersky, Windows, defender
item.description:
• The case of the exploding pagers and walkie-talkies
  • "Ford seeks patent for tech that listens to driver conversations to serve ads"
  • Another large chunk of personal data exposed
  • Passkeys takes a big step forward: Now supported by Chrome
  • A nascent 9.9 Linux Unauthenticated RCE?
  • Freezing Credit
  • Credit Bureaus
  • Drobo 5N
  • SN email labeled as spam
  • Public Wi-fi saftey
  • SN for Certs
  • Windows Defender
  • Kaspersky exits the U.S.

item.title: SN 990: Is Telegram an Encrypted App? - CrowdStrike Exodus, DDoS-as-a-Service, 'Active Listening' Ad Tech?
item.itunes:title: Is Telegram an Encrypted App? - CrowdStrike Exodus, DDoS-as-a-Service, 'Active Listening' Ad Tech?
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: CrowdStrike Exodus, DDoS-as-a-Service, 'Active Listening' Ad Tech?
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, Telegram encryption, end-to-end encryption, secure messaging, Pavel Durov arrest, Telegram controversy, Telegram security, encrypted messaging apps, Telegram Secret Chats, Telegram vulnerabilities
item.description:
• Telegram puts End-to-End Privacy in the Crosshairs
  • Free security logging is good for everyone
  • CrowdStrike hemorrhaging customers
  • Microsoft to meet privately with EDR (Endpoint Detection & Response) vendors
  • Yelp's Unhappy with Google
  • Telegram as the hotbed for DDoSass DDoS as a Service
  • Chrome grows more difficult to exploit
  • Cox Media Group's "Active Listening" has apparently not ended
  • Cascading Bloom Filter follow-up
  • Closing the Loop
  • Is Telegram an encrypted app?

Show Notes - https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-990-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

  • bigid.com/securitynow
  • threatlocker.com for Security Now
  • vanta.com/SECURITYNOW
  • joindeleteme.com/twit promo code TWIT

item.title: SN 989: Cascading Bloom Filters - Key Card Backdoors, Fake Cisco Gear
item.itunes:title: Cascading Bloom Filters - Key Card Backdoors, Fake Cisco Gear
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Key Card Backdoors, Fake Cisco Gear
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, crowdstrike, most epic fail awards, cisco, SpinRite, npd, national public data
item.description:
• CrowdStrike Exec's "Most Epic Fail" Award
  • Hardware backdoors discovered in Chinese-made key cards
  • Counterfeit CISCO networking gear
  • SpinRite
  • Errata
